pro_course_detail.title: Become fluent in French through a mix of lessons and conversations / Domina el franc√©s a trav√©s de una mezcla de lecciones y conversaciones
pro_course_detail.description:
My method, which combines lessons and conversation, is based on my training and experience as a teacher as well as on my experience as a language learner. It's important to know that learning a language is mainly achieved through practice. We have a saying in French: "C'est en forgeant qu'on devient forgeron." You can learn all the vocabulary you want, it'll disappear if it's not maintained regularly. It's the learning of vocabulary IN CONTEXT that allows a better fixation of knowledge.

For this, I've developed a technique:
Before each conversation, I send you a list of words and grammatical structures that you'll need in the conversation. This allows you:
- to have enough vocabulary to be able to converse
- to use the words and grammatical rules you have learned out of context IN CONTEXT and to remember them better.
In addition, the conversations, each time on a different theme, allow you to expand your vocabulary on a wide range of subjects.

SPANISH VERSION : 
Mi m√©todo, que combina las lecciones y la conversaci√≥n, se basa tanto en mi formaci√≥n como profesor como en mi experiencia como estudiante y profesor de idiomas. Es importante saber que el aprendizaje de un idioma se realiza principalmente a trav√©s de la pr√°ctica. Tenemos una expresi√≥n en franc√©s: "C'est en forgeant qu'on devient forgeron." Puedes aprender todo el vocabulario que quieras, pero desaparecer√° si no se mantiene con regularidad. Es el aprendizaje del vocabulario EN CONTEXTO lo que permite una mejor fijaci√≥n del conocimiento.
Para ello, he desarrollado una t√©cnica:
Antes de cada conversaci√≥n, le env√≠o una lista de palabras y estructuras gramaticales que necesitar√° en la conversaci√≥n. Esto le permite :
- tener suficiente vocabulario para poder conversar
- utilizar las palabras y las reglas gramaticales que has aprendido fuera de contexto en CONTEXTO y recordarlas mejor.
Adem√°s, las conversaciones, cada vez sobre un tema diferente le permiten ampliar su vocabulario sobre una amplia gama de temas.

My students can feel free to be themselves and talk to me about anything. My goal as a teacher is to help improve all my students' confidence with English. I will be focusing on conversational English, Grammar, pronunciation, and English Fluency. I also have a Corporate background, therefore I can assist students with corporate-related needs such as (preparing for an interview, preparing for a presentation, or even going over a business plan).
teacher_info.teaching_style: Lessons with me are conversational. I believe that students learn best when they are free and comfortable to just be themselves. In that way, I can pick up mistakes and help correct my students' pronunciation and fluency in English. My students can expect fun class quizzes and PowerPoint presentations.

"Summary for Busy Individuals:

Consequently, attempting to achieve goals and requests solely through learning from textbooks oneself and from uncertified teachers who teach mechanically can lead to failure. Are you struggling to find the right words, grammar, or expressions when learning Korean? Do you find it challenging to distinguish between similar words and phrases that are often mistranslated? If so, our comprehensive dictionary is perfect for you!

Introducing our comprehensive dictionary, filled with words, grammar, expressions, and more, that you can reference at any time to enhance your Korean language learning. With our dictionary, you'll never be at a loss for words or phrases again!

All entries in our dictionary are organized by subject and have been analyzed and entered by a professional Korean language teacher, Sean Shin. The best words, grammar, and materials have been carefully selected and organized, and we update them daily to ensure you have access to the most up-to-date information.

Our dictionary is customizable, allowing you to quickly find the words, grammar, and materials you need by pressing "Ctrl+F." And if there's something you can't find, or if you need additional resources, you can request updates to the list at any time from us.

With our comprehensive dictionary, you won't need to buy any other materials to learn Korean. And if you have any questions or need further guidance, we're always available to help you on Italki. So why wait? Start learning Korean today with our comprehensive dictionary!

"Easy Japanese" is a program of Japanese language lessons produced by Japan's public broadcaster, NHK WORLD RADIO JAPAN. You can learn basic grammar and useful expressions through lessons designed in audio-drama style. You can download audio and texts for the lessons free of charge.

Introduction of the story
The heroine of the story is Anna, a 20-year-old Thai student who loves Japanese manga. She has come to Japan to learn the Japanese language for one year at a university in Tokyo. She will learn practical Japanese through various experiences, such as classes at the university, daily life at a dormitory, shopping, and traveling.

teacher_info.intro:
I'm in Miyazaki, was Tokyo for 5y, and spent some time in the US, have a mechanic and curator's background. I finished translating my 3y lifework novel. I try to make the world find me.

I spoke French offline for the 1st time at French restaurant in Tokyo in June. My French is still poor, but I was delighted so talked up a storm!
I could have used English or Japanese. But even if you say same things, it becomes an amazing time. Before getting to know people, there is a wall. Language easily breaks the wall.

No exaggeration to say I study language only for seemingly insignificant moments. This is my best moment.

You decided to start Japanese for the same reason? Hope to see you soon:)

teacher_info.about_teacher:
Right now, I am conducting conversation, culture, life in Japan, and travel-oriented classes for people who have above A1 level or who live in Japan.

I like to deliver fun and productive classes that will help you reach your goals, whether they're quantifiable (textbook JLPT driven) or more abstract (enjoying manga/ conversation etc). My student reviews below are a good indicator of my range.

I studied a lot more about Japanese culture, customs, ideas, history, and calendar events as a hobby than I did about teaching Japanese. I teach Japanese, but what you will learn is bigger than the language.
teacher_info.teaching_style:
I've developed a format optimized for 1on1 lessons. 
I've created a unique, streamlined Japanese vocabulary system in the form of topical or grammar lists I can share on the spot. This system is designed to 'free' the students from the barrier of unfamiliar vocabulary on specific topics during both free conversation and more structured study. 

My motto: Practice thoroughly until using unconsciously üìöüí™üó£Ô∏è
teacher_info.cancel_policy: I support you learning, enjoying Japanese. And I discuss about your Japanese tasks. But I don't do or finish your tasks instead of you.

pro_course_detail.title: Learn from A1 to C1
pro_course_detail.description:
Teach Japanese from A1 To Intermediate levels structurally, practically. Basically using textbooks. But every lesson is conversation-oriented.

This lesson work if you apply at least one of the following items.
üåø If you want to-
„Éªstart learning Japanese on italki
„Éªnot only learn fundamentally but converse more
„Éªlearn from a teacher who respects what you've already learned
„Éªget flexible fundamentals
„Éªlearn vocabularies in each topic
„Éªunderstand a system of Japanese language
„Éªlearn not only Japanese but every aspect of knowledge
„Éªpreparation for JLPT
„Éªkeep motivative for your self-learning
„Éªlearn for your interests about Japanese language.
„Éªlive in Japan
„Éªenjoy manga/drama/movies/anime in Japanese

I'm also welcome students who are already studying Japanese, want to learn Japanese for living in Japan, and as a hobby.

If you are already studying on your own and are not confident in your fundamentals, from the conversation I will analise your grammar and vocabulary style and provide you with a shorter path to structure practice.

I can also provide information and language to help you deal with situations that arise when traveling and living in Japan. And of course, how to read signs, menus, and signboards.

I'm welcome and respect all students' motives!!
If the challenge feeling is born in your heart,  feel free to hit the gate of the lessons:)
Let's make you're studying Japanese a Great journey!!


üôè Apology in advance: In this course, basically, I use the textbook Genki, Minna no Nihongo, intermediate Japanese, Tobira, Try JLPT. If you have any textbooks please tell me.

We will practice all scenarios of your working life to give you more confidence to get more

teacher_info.introduction:
I work as an English/Spanish/Chinese translator, and part time TOEFL/IELTS/HSK teacher. I offer three kinds of classes : Test Preparation, Free talk practice, and Structured classes(Business/Daily life). 

For conversational classes: We can simulate daily life/business situations in English/Chinese speaking countries through the following topics, and learn grammar along the way. 

‚û°Ô∏èHaving small talk (hobbies, technology, culinary, arts, music, entertainment, sports, stereotypes, cultural shocks, politics ,social events) 
‚û°Ô∏èGoing for a job interview(Introducing oneself's education background and work experiences) 
‚û°Ô∏èTravelling(Hotel reservation/check-in&check-out, Ordering tickets,Asking for directions) ‚û°Ô∏èShopping(bargaining,asking for exchange/refund /after-sale service) 
‚û°Ô∏èAt the gym(Muscle & body parts, names of workouts and equipment) 
‚û°Ô∏èAt the bank(Opening accounts, currency exchange, making loans, transferring credit, reporting loss) 
‚û°Ô∏èSeeing a doctor(Making appointments, names of common illnesses) 
‚û°Ô∏èAt work(Asking for a leave,promotion,pay raise, signing of contracts) 
‚û°Ô∏èSchool life(sophomore parties, courses, scholarship interviews) 
‚û°Ô∏èDating(confession, complementing your date) 
‚û°Ô∏èMaking a police report(lost of passport and important belongings/describing an accident & physical characteristics/mental states of people) 

‚û°Ô∏èBUSINESS English/Mandarin (Receiving clients, clarifying stakes, making concessions ,discussing the bottom line, company organization, executive meetings, performance reviews,doing presentations, trends, SWOT analysis, statistical reports, web-based marketing, costing, budgets, auditing, fundraising, confidentiality, contracts, copyright, patents, environmental regulations, marketing surveys, target audience, print and media advertising, promotional events, selling points, trade shows, product demonstration, following up on leeds sourcing, Export/Import, mergers, competition, recruiting personnel, welfare, teambuilding)
teacher_info.about_me:
IELTS/ÈõÖÊÄù Simon - Intro
- IELTS

teacher_info.about_teacher: I have taught over 10,000 lessons on italki, and I am skilled in teaching both kids and adults. Under my approach, many of my students have achieved fluency, and excellent scores in standardized tests like IELTS and HSK. I have also researched and self-created contents for over 500+ daily scenarios, each dialogue is specially designed, so grammar structures are taught naturally through the dialogues, to ensure easy understanding. These topics pretty much cover every possible scenario in life, so you can be sure that you would reach a near native level of vocabulary after learning them.
teacher_info.teaching_style:
‚û°Ô∏è Test preparation (IELTS / HSK): Practice on Speaking, Writing, Listening and Reading questions, with feedback and correction, as well as strategies and tips to improve. 

‚û°Ô∏è For role-play simulation: We will role play common scenarios after learning sentence structures and vocabulary of a certain topic (Renting an apartment, Job interviews, Traveling etc)

‚û°Ô∏èFree-talk practice: We will be discussing topics you are interested in, (sports, movies, fashion, relationships, arts, culinary, politics, environmental issues, technologies etc)

Hi everyone, my name is Tammy, and I am 26 years old. I am from China. I studied English during my university years and my postgraduate study in American Studies. I hope to help you understand Chinese culture better and to help you improve your speaking skills as much as I can. If you are not fluent in Chinese, that's fine, I will explain it to you slowly. I love talking and learning with people, and my vision is to make China more accessible to foreigners. I hope to learn with you in the future.

teacher_info.intro:
My name is Esther, I am 25 years old from South Africa. I love traveling, watching movies and trying out new dishes. I write short articles and read novels when I'm not watching dog videos and playing with my dog.

Outside of work, I am involved in pageantry and I do charity work, which includes presenting motivational talks to students in marginalised communities and donating basic resources. I love singing, dancing and spend time playing karaoke.

I am a Math and Science teacher by profession.

I am currently pursuing a Postgraduate diploma in education  (Mathematics and science). I have 5 months of Classroom experience teaching Math and Science.

teacher_info.intro:
My name is Dr. Hannah Stevens and I am a writer with a PhD in English and creative writing. I have taught around the world in universities and worked with organisations including the BBC, the British Embassy and Greenpeace. 

My second book ON THE BODIES OF STRANGERS will be published in 2024. My first book IN THEIR ABSENCE was released in 2021 and has recently been translated in to a Bulgarian edition.

I am originally from England but currently live in Tainan, Taiwan. 

I enjoy teaching, writing, reading, travelling and connecting with new people from different cultures.
